memoryVerse: "But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth." – Acts 1:8

one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. What from the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study impacted you most in the past week?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read Acts 1:1-4; Luke 24:13-49.
After Jesus' death and resurrection, He appeared before the disciples for 40 days.

questions.questionText: 3. How did the Lord engage with His followers in the days after Jesus' death and resurrection?

4. Why was it important that Jesus spend time – 40 days – alone with the disciples after His resurrection and before His ascension? If Jesus were physically with us now, what would you want to ask Him or talk about?
5. How could the proofs of Jesus' resurrection help you when life is difficult or doubts arise?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read Acts 1:4-8.
Jesus promised the Holy Spirit would come soon.

questions.questionText: 6. What was Jesus' command? What would the coming Spirit empower the apostles to do?
7. a. What difference does the Holy Spirit make in a person's life? (For help, see Romans 8:9, 14-16; 2 Corinthians 1:21-22; Galatians 5:22-23.)
7. b. If you have professed your faith in Jesus Christ, what difference has the Holy Spirit made in your life? (Be specific.)

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read Acts 1:4-11, John 14:1-3, 16-18; 16:12-15.
After 40 days, Jesus ascended to heaven.

questions.questionText: 8. Why was it necessary for Jesus to leave the apostles?
9. What truths about the return of Jesus Christ do you see?
10. What comfort and assurance might the apostles have received through the promises of this passage?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read Acts 1:12-26.
The apostles gathered and chose Judas' replacement.

questions.questionText: 11. Who were the people who prayed together? What do you learn from this?
12. What stands out to you about the replacement of Judas with Matthias?
13. How do you see God at work in these verses?
14. How has this week's study impacted your thinking and trust in the Lord's will and timing?
